originalText.text: The worst medical office. First, they’re not open the time is listed online. Second, the secretary, medical assistant or whoever is there are NOT professional at all. Third, to see Mendez is like seeing the president of the United States. You can’t count with them for an emergency at all.

text.text: The worst medical office. First, they’re not open the time is listed online. Second, the secretary, medical assistant or whoever is there are NOT professional at all. Third, to see Mendez is like seeing the president of the United States. You can’t count with them for an emergency at all.

originalText.text: I am writing this review on behalf of my father who passed away 3 months ago. This office has a very outdated medical record system and his hours of availability are not consistent. The reception staff don't like to answer the phone and when they do, they are very rude and do not want to assist. When you bring this to the attention of the MD, he is very defensive and says you are lying. My father went to this doctor for more than 10 years and the main reason he went to him was because he was down the block. I wish my father would not have been so stubborn and went to a clinic, nowadays any tests or blood work, patient and family can have access to. When my father attended this doctor, he would not know any result until weeks and sometimes a month later. MD follow up is poor in this medical office.  I feel like if this MD would have given my father an MRI refferal maybe he would have had more time in this world. I work in the healthcare field, and I urge u to please follow my advice.

I feel like if this MD would have given my father an MRI refferal maybe he would have had more time in this world. I work in the healthcare field, and I urge u to please follow my advice.

originalText.text:
This was my grandmother’s doctors years ago. She was in her 70’s and kept telling this doctor that she felt as if something inside her was growing. He never did any type of test nor referred her to anyone else. Instead, he told her it was in her head; given her age. Her condition got worse as now she had really itchy skin. Her kids took her to the specialists in the Dominican Republic and came back with a Stage 4 Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma diagnosis. She came back to NY to start chemo but died about 2 months later.

My mom goes here now and needs a referral to see a neurologist, it wasn’t until we got on the phone and yelled at them that they gave her a referral. Older Spanish people feel comfortable going to these local doctors because of the language and location. Please don’t settle.

Her kids took her to the specialists in the Dominican Republic and came back with a Stage 4 Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma diagnosis. She came back to NY to start chemo but died about 2 months later.

My mom goes here now and needs a referral to see a neurologist, it wasn’t until we got on the phone and yelled at them that they gave her a referral. Older Spanish people feel comfortable going to these local doctors because of the language and location. Please don’t settle.

originalText.text: Tried on four separate occasions to get an appointment. First time- got an appointment time only to show up at the office to sign up for *another time. Called the morning of the second appointment and was told the doctor just “wasn’t in sometimes” and to call back later. Went through this dance twice more w the doctor either never showing up or only accepting appointments in the last hour of the day when I was at work. Fourth try- was finally told no new patients were being accepted (but not before they asked what insurance I was on. Which strikes me as beyond sketchy)  Complete and utter waste of time. Awful communication and consistency. Find any other office if you aren’t already established with this one.

originalText.text: This doctor used to be my doctor many years ago. He is still my parent’s doctor. Worst doctor ever. I continue to urge my parents to switch but they are set in their ways. How is it that you have to go to the clinic at 6am, sign in and wait until 12pm for the doctor to arrive? Smh
